title.narrative: Syrian Refugees in Lebanon - Capacity Building for Municipal Responses Project 2

description.narrative: Mercy Corps believes that for conflict prevention programming to be successful it must not only involve both Lebanese and Syrians and Palestinians, but it must work through the municipality and build upon local governance structures for programming to be sustainable and establish the necessary systems. Furthermore, as resilience requires all three types of social capital, bonding, bridging and linking the prerequisite of building true resilience, is engaging all three actors.

Outcome: Resource tensions between Lebanese and Syrians in two vulnerable Lebanese municipalities mitigated through joint Lebanese-Syrian local community problem analysis, and solution delivery in partnership with the municipality
Output 1: Operationalise the recommendations of the CP funded Mercy Corps Municipality Guide, to enable target municipalities to better leverage external sources of power, influence and resources
Output 2: A coalition of municipal, Lebanese host and Syrian refugee community leaders are able to identify and understand sources of common resource based tensions and concerns that would trigger violence if left unaddressed.
Output 3: Lebanese and Syrian refugee communities are involved in the improvement and expansion of local municipal social service planning and provision to better address resource tensions.
